sentence: US stock futures rebounded from a string of losses as the feeding frenzy on the Turkish lira was suspended and German economic data soothed shell-shocked European investors.
Dow futures were indicated to open more than 100 points higher with technology and energy shares outperforming.

The beleaguered Turkish lira finally regained its footing from its historic lows against the major currencies despite meek intervention efforts by the Turkish central bank and more nationalistic rhetoric from President Erdogan who urged citizens to boycott western electronics.
The rebound in Europe gained momentum with the help of upbeat German and EU GDP data and an unexpected drop in the UK jobless rate.
Asian markets were not as buoyant with the Shanghai and Hang Seng weighed down by soft Chinese industrial production data and an unexpected jump in the jobless rate to 5.1% from 4.8%, previously.
Positive price action on Wall Street was amplified by stellar quarterly results from Home Depot ( HD ) and friendly inflation data as July import and export prices were both below expectations.
Led by a 5.3% drop in agriculture prices, export prices were down 0.5% last month, well below expectations for a 0.2% gain, while import prices were unchanged versus the estimated +0.1%.
Excluding petroleum, import prices were lower by 0.1%.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
